author: COMSOL
description:
A Fabry–Perot resonator is one of the fundamental optical devices and has a broad range of applications. A few example applications are length measurement, frequency and/or wavelength measurement or filtering of specific spatial modes.

This model uses the Electromagnetic Waves, Beam Envelopes interface in the bidirectional formulation to efficiently compute mode shape and reflection/transmission properties of a macroscopic Fabry–Perot resonator.
label: fabry_perot_resonator.mph
name: root
